Review_Text: The documentary is life affirming, story is powerful, filming - sensational and a reminder of how short and amazing life is. Truly felt like we were part of his journey in Nepal and showed how a positive mindset in the day to day can make a difference not only to your own life but to others.Overall emotional - seeing some of the highs and lows and thinking about how I would have coped in his shoes. His bravery and special soul shone through.Thank you to Ed for sharing his story and to the production crew for putting it all together. IConic movie that is worth seeing and sharing with others.

This film is more than just a story of recovery; it's a testament to the power of the human spirit, resilience, and the healing force of nature. Steele masterfully captures Ed's physical and emotional battles, as well as the unwavering support from his wife, Lois, making it a raw and deeply moving watch.Wow! I feel so inspired. The cinematography is breathtaking, immersing viewers in the vast landscapes Ed conquers, while the documentary's honest storytelling sheds light on the mental struggles that come with trauma and recovery. It's a film that lingers with you long after the credits roll, leaving you feeling inspired and reminded of the strength we all have within us.A must-watch for anyone who loves stories of perseverance, adventure, and the power of the human will.
